---
slug: /207
title: "This Week In React #207: Next.js, use cache, shadcn/ui, Headless UI, RN 0.76, New Architecture, NativeWind, Expo 52, Edge-to-Edge, RNTL, Reassure, Bottom Tabs, Flutter, Node.js..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 10-30-2024
---
Hi everyone!
This is another great React week.

translations.fr: C'est une autre excellente semaine pour React.
translations.en: C'est une autre super semaine pour React.

segments.source_content: Vercel has unveiled new super-interesting caching APIs for Next.js, and the React Native ecosystem is on fire!

translations.fr: Vercel a d√©voil√© de nouvelles API de mise en cache extr√™mement int√©ressantes pour Next.js, et l'√©cosyst√®me React Native est en effervescence !

segments.source_content: On my side, I'm a bit tired of Twitter penalizing me for commenting external links. I'm giving Bluesky a try ([@sebastienlorber.com](https://bsky.app/profile/sebastienlorber.com)). Come say hi if you are there.

translations.fr: De mon c√¥t√©, je suis un peu fatigu√© que Twitter me p√©nalise pour avoir comment√© des liens externes. J'essaie Bluesky ([@sebastienlorber.com](https://bsky.app/profile/sebastienlorber.com)). Venez dire bonjour si vous y √™tes.
translations.en: De mon c√¥t√©, je suis un peu fatigu√© que Twitter me p√©nalise pour commenter des liens externes. J'essaie Bluesky ([@sebastienlorber.com](https://bsky.app/profile/sebastienlorber.com)). Venez me dire bonjour si vous y √™tes.

segments.source_content: Don't forget to fill in the [State of React survey](https://survey.devographics.com/en-US/survey/state-of-react/2024?source=this_week_in_react), and mention that you read the newsletter üòá.

segments.source_content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![Next.js Conf 2024 Recap](/emails/issues/207/nextjsconf.jpg)](https://vercel.com/blog/recap-next-js-conf-2024)
[**Next.js Conf 2024 Recap**](https://vercel.com/blog/recap-next-js-conf-2024)
Last week, the community gathered at the Next.js conference. This recap is a nice overview of the highlights, including:

translations.fr: La semaine derni√®re, la communaut√© s'est r√©unie √† la conf√©rence Next.js. Ce r√©capitulatif pr√©sente les points forts, notamment :
translations.en: La semaine derni√®re, la communaut√© s'est r√©unie √† la conf√©rence Next.js. Ce bilan pr√©sente les points forts, notamment :

segments.source_content:
- Next.js 15 stable
- Turbopack Dev stable
- Simpler caching, reduced complexity
- Self-hosting improvements and templates

translations.fr:
- Next.js 15 stable
- Turbopack Dev stable
- Mise en cache simplifi√©e, complexit√© r√©duite
- Am√©liorations et mod√®les d'auto-h√©bergement
translations.en:
- Next.js 15 stable
- Turbopack Dev stable
- Mise en cache simplifi√©e, complexit√© r√©duite
- Am√©liorations de l'auto-h√©bergement et mod√®les

segments.source_content: The sister blog post [Our Journey with Caching](https://nextjs.org/blog/our-journey-with-caching) is particularly interesting, introducing new experimental caching semantics and APIs such as `use cache`, `cacheTag`, and `cacheLife`. It‚Äôs a more flexible system, and super cool that you don‚Äôt even need to provide a cache key.

translations.fr: L'article compl√©mentaire [Notre parcours avec la mise en cache](https://nextjs.org/blog/our-journey-with-caching) est particuli√®rement int√©ressant, introduisant de nouvelles s√©mantiques et API de mise en cache exp√©rimentales comme `use cache`, `cacheTag` et `cacheLife`. C'est un syst√®me plus flexible, et particuli√®rement int√©ressant que vous n'ayez m√™me pas besoin de fournir de cl√© de cache.
translations.en: L'article de blog compl√©mentaire [Notre parcours avec la mise en cache](https://nextjs.org/blog/our-journey-with-caching) est particuli√®rement int√©ressant, pr√©sentant de nouvelles s√©mantiques et API exp√©rimentales de mise en cache comme `use cache`, `cacheTag` et `cacheLife`. C'est un syst√®me plus flexible, et particuli√®rement pratique car vous n'avez m√™me pas besoin de fournir une cl√© de cache.

The article explains their implementation decisions.
- üìú [Conditional React hooks pattern](https://robinmalfait.com/blog/conditional-react-hooks-pattern): Maintainer of Headless UI shares trick he uses in the library, passing `enabled` as first parameter to hooks.

- üìú [Add an RSS Feed to a Next.js Blog](https://didoesdigital.com/blog/nextjs-blog-09-rss/): Use a static route returning XML. Note I beg you to add an RSS feed, otherwise I have to pay Inoreader 0.20‚Ç¨/month to track your blog through selectors üòÖ.
- üìú [How to roll your own auth in JavaScript & TypeScript](https://www.robinwieruch.de/how-to-roll-your-own-auth/): Step-by-step guide to implement auth in Next.js 15\.
- üìú [useContextSelector: Speeding Up React Apps With Large Context](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/10/16/usecontextselector-a-faster-usecontext-for-react.html)
- üìú [When to use redirect() vs. router.push() in Next.js](https://darios.blog/posts/redirect-vs-router-push-in-nextjs)
- üìú [How To Set Up Next.js 15 For Production In 2024](https://janhesters.com/blog/how-to-set-up-nextjs-15-for-production-in-2024)

- üì¶ [MDX 3.1](https://github.com/mdx-js/mdx/releases/tag/3.1.0)
- üì¶ [Medusa 2.0 \- Next.js and Remix starters](https://medusajs.com/starters/): This open source alternative to Shopify launched new major version, including various React-based e-commerce storefront starters.

segments.source_content: Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, GitBook, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code faster.

L'int√©gration de Blacksmith ne n√©cessite qu'une seule modification de code. Plus de 100 entreprises comme Ashby, GitBook, Superblocks et Slope utilisent Blacksmith pour aider les d√©veloppeurs √† fusionner leur code plus rapidement.

L'int√©gration de Blacksmith ne n√©cessite qu'une modification d'une ligne de code. Plus de 100 entreprises comme Ashby, GitBook, Superblocks et Slope utilisent Blacksmith pour aider les d√©veloppeurs √† fusionner du code plus rapidement.

segments.source_content: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
[![New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more](/emails/issues/207/newarch.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)
[**React Native 0.76 \- New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)

translations.fr: [**React Native 0.76 - Nouvelle Architecture par d√©faut, DevTools et plus**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)
translations.en: [**React Native 0.76 - Nouvelle Architecture par d√©faut, DevTools et plus**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)

segments.source_content: React Native 0.76 is out with major updates\! The New Architecture is now enabled by default, there's a new React Native DevTools for improved debugging, and CSS support for `boxShadow` and `filter` for enhanced UI effects (available only with the new architecture). Be aware of some breaking changes: minimum SDK requirements have been raised to iOS 15.1 and Android SDK 24 (Android 7). Time to upgrade and check it out\!

translations.fr: React Native 0.76 est disponible avec des mises √† jour majeures ! La Nouvelle Architecture est maintenant activ√©e par d√©faut, un nouvel outil React Native DevTools am√©liore le d√©bogage, et le support CSS pour `boxShadow` et `filter` permet des effets UI avanc√©s (uniquement avec la nouvelle architecture). Attention aux changements cassants : les SDK minimum requis sont maintenant iOS 15.1 et Android SDK 24 (Android 7). C'est le moment de mettre √† niveau et d'essayer !
translations.en: React Native 0.76 est sorti avec des mises √† jour majeures ! La Nouvelle Architecture est d√©sormais activ√©e par d√©faut, un nouvel outil React Native DevTools am√©liore le d√©bogage, et la prise en charge CSS pour `boxShadow` et `filter` permet des effets d'interface avanc√©s (uniquement avec la nouvelle architecture). Attention aux changements cassants : les SDK minimum requis passent √† iOS 15.1 et Android SDK 24 (Android 7). Il est temps de mettre √† niveau et de l'essayer !

segments.source_content: v0.76 is cool, but what‚Äôs even better is that the [New Architecture is here](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here) and officially declared ready to be used in production\! This is a multi-year effort and a huge milestone for the React Native ecosystem\! At this point, you probably already heard about JSI, Fabric, Turbomodules, synchronous low-overhead bridgeless communication, interop mode, and more. It‚Äôs not just about performance, but also solving important UX/DX problems such as being able to measure views synchronously to position a tooltip, or having `useLayoutEffect` work like on the web. What excites me most is also probably the most underrated: React Native can finally use React 18+ concurrent features, notably transitions, Suspense, and what‚Äôs coming next.

translations.fr: La v0.76 est cool, mais ce qui est encore mieux, c'est que la [Nouvelle Architecture est l√†](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here) et officiellement d√©clar√©e pr√™te pour la production ! C'est un effort de plusieurs ann√©es et une √©norme √©tape pour l'√©cosyst√®me React Native ! √Ä ce stade, vous avez probablement d√©j√† entendu parler de JSI, Fabric, Turbomodules, de la communication bridgeless synchrone √† faible latence, du mode interop, et plus encore. Il ne s'agit pas seulement de performances, mais aussi de r√©soudre d'importants probl√®mes UX/DX comme mesurer des vues de fa√ßon synchrone pour positionner une infobulle, ou faire fonctionner `useLayoutEffect` comme sur le web. Ce qui m'enthousiasme le plus est probablement le plus sous-estim√© : React Native peut enfin utiliser les fonctionnalit√©s concurrentes de React 18+, notamment les transitions, Suspense et ce qui vient ensuite.
translations.en: La v0.76 est cool, mais ce qui est encore mieux, c'est que la [Nouvelle Architecture est l√†](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here) et officiellement d√©clar√©e pr√™te pour la production ! Ce r√©sultat couronne un effort de plusieurs ann√©es et constitue un jalon majeur pour l'√©cosyst√®me React Native. Vous connaissez probablement d√©j√† JSI, Fabric, Turbomodules, la communication synchrone sans pont √† faible surcharge, le mode interop, etc. Au-del√† des performances, cela r√©sout des probl√®mes UX/DX cruciaux comme mesurer des vues synchronement pour positionner des infobulles ou faire fonctionner `useLayoutEffect` comme sur le web. Ce qui m'enthousiasme le plus, probablement le plus sous-estim√© : React Native peut enfin utiliser les fonctionnalit√©s concurrentes de React 18+, notamment les transitions, Suspense et les innovations √† venir.

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Expo Starter Kit - The Swiss Army Knife of Mobile App Building](https://expostarter.com?utm_source=this-week-in-react&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-10-30-2024)
- üì£ [React Native Announcement \- Handling Android 15's edge-to-edge enforcement](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/discussions/827): Android 15 changes how content is displayed on screen. SafeAreaView is going to be deprecated. The new library [react-native-edge-to-edge](https://github.com/zoontek/react-native-edge-to-edge) is an alternative to fully embrace edge-to-edge rendering. Note it just reached 1.0 and is supported by Expo.
- üì£ [Flipper repository is being archived](https://fbflipper.com/blog/2024/10/24/changes-to-oss-flipper/)
- üóìÔ∏è¬†[RNLConf](https://www.reactnativelondon.co.uk/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) \- üá¨üáß¬†London - 14 & 15 November - Last chance to grab a ticket ! Don‚Äôt forget your discount with code ‚ÄúTWIR‚Äù.
- üìú [React Native, and ‚Äúthe native feel‚Äù](https://mozzius.dev/post/3l777nhz4h32w): Bluesky dev explains how they made their Expo app feel native. It‚Äôs the sum of many little details, such as hairlineWidth, bottom sheets, animations, navigation.
- üìú [Animated Spiral with React Native Skia](https://reactiive.io/articles/animated-spiral): Reactiive just relaunched his blog with greatly interactive animated Skia playgrounds, very satisfying to look at\!
- üìú [Enhance App Performance and Business Growth With Real User Monitoring (RUM)](https://www.callstack.com/blog/enhance-app-performance-and-business-with-real-user-monitoring-rum)
- üìú [Improve User Experience and First-Time App Load with Expo and libSQL](https://www.expostarter.com/blog/expo-libsql-improve-app-performance)
- üìú [We're forking Flutter. This is why](https://flutterfoundation.dev/blog/posts/we-are-forking-flutter-this-is-why/)
- üì¶ [Expo SDK 52 beta](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/10-24-sdk-52-beta): Huge release including New Architecture, DOM Components, Expo Router 4, preview of Server Components‚Ä¶ We‚Äôll cover all this in a few weeks once it‚Äôs table\!
- üì¶ [NativeWind 4.1](https://www.nativewind.dev/v4-1-announcement): NativeWind v4 is finally published as latest on npm and ready for production!
- üì¶ [Jetpack Compose React Native](https://github.com/andrew-levy/jetpack-compose-react-native/): Andrew first created SwiftUI bindings and now working on an equivalent for Jetpack Compose. These are cool libraries that may help native developers join our community\!

- üì¶ [React Native visionOS 0.76 \- New Architecture by default, debugger support](https://github.com/callstack/react-native-visionos/releases/tag/v0.76.0-visionos)
- üì¶ [React Native for TV 0.76 \- New Architecture by default, support for NativeWind](https://github.com/react-native-tvos/react-native-tvos/releases/tag/v0.76.0-0)
- üì¶ [React Native Testing Library 12.8 \- Option to enable New Architecture concurrent rendering](https://github.com/callstack/react-native-testing-library/releases/tag/v12.8.0)
- üì¶ [Reassure 1.3 \- Improves `measureRenders` precision](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/releases/tag/reassure%401.3.0)
- üì¶ [React Native 0.76.1 \- Bugfixes](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.76.1)
- üì¶ [Radon IDE 0.0.21-beta](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v0.0.21-beta)

- üé• [Catalin Miron \- React Native Onboarding Pagination Indicator \- Reanimated](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m8ATJwrAif0)
